results.title: Personal Assistant
results.description:
Strafe Creative is seeking a hands-on, experienced PA to support the Managing Director in ongoing business growth. We’ve been growing steadily over the last few years, working on bigger projects, with more clients and regularly hiring new members of staff. Overseeing the business growth is the Managing Director, who, after 12 years in the role is keen to work with a dedicated Personal Assistant to keep them organised and focused on the ongoing growth of the business.

The Role

Who are we?
Strafe Creative is an independent, award-winning digital design agency, proud to be working on a range of projects, from websites and mobile gaming to SaaS apps and more.

We’re based in Nottingham, however remote working is the new office life these days so this role can be based anywhere, although we’d love to see you in the office once a month or so. We’re a fun, passionate bunch of people to work with and we’d love someone like-minded to join us!

Learn a bit more about Strafe:

  • Who we are and what we do
  • What it’s really like to work at Strafe by the people who work there
  • The Strafe Creative Family Policy, because work isn’t your whole life
  • A sneak peak into how we are always learning and growing


What’s the job then?
As the first PA within the business, you’ll have the opportunity to grow and shape the role as you see fit. Typical tasks will include:


  • Inbox Management & Calendar Appointments on behalf of the MD; filing, prioritising and responding where appropriate
  • Taking meeting notes - to help keep everyone in the loop on sales or client meetings
  • Managing ad-hoc travel arrangements, including flights, accommodation and itineraries
  • Supporting the delivery of ad hoc research and projects in partnership with the Managing Director
  • Updating and creating presentations - so that the MD can focus on looking after the client experience
  • Keeping the Director on track - making sure they attend priority meetings and stick to the business goals and actions
  • Updating the CRM System (Hubspot) to ensure the quality of lead and client data is of a very high standard
  • Updating and managing key sales documents via the Google suite


Sound up your street? Here’s how to apply
Send us a CV, cover letter and a short video no more than 2 minutes long. We're keen to hire a new team member that fits in with us - someone who is a real people person and enjoys working closely with the team.

In the video, please talk about one of the following topics and show us how you communicate:


  • The thing you're most proud of and why
  • Your favourite hobby and why you love it
  • Your best holiday and why


(Hint, we want to see you talking about something you love and how you handle the direction we've provided).

Cover letter-wise, focus on what you would bring to the role and how you would go about managing our busy MD.

Please send all three items to careers@strafecreative.co.uk or use the form at the bottom of this page to submit.

Salary

£24-£28k (Based on experience)

results.title: SAP Business One Consultant
results.description:
About Sapphire Systems:

Sapphire is the largest digital operating transformation provider to the mid-market and mid-enterprise clients. Our mission is to turn operating friction into digital business momentum. Through the passion and expertise of our people, we unlock the cloud-delivered operating platforms, digital user experiences, data analytics, and intelligent automation that transforms our client’s operational performance. We are globally significant partners for SAP, ServiceNow, Automation Anywhere, Infor, Hexagon and AWS, and we have transformed the digital operating capacity, capability, intelligence and resilience of over 1,250 clients in the UK and US through our portfolio of consulting, design, delivery, lifecycle service, and cloud services.


Job Summary:

This key client facing role requires the combination of

  • demonstrable SAP Business One configuration ability and knowledge (version 9.3+).
  • a client-engagement skill set that is both flexible and inspires confidence.

The role operates within the SAP B1 practice and across the many different industries in which Sapphire provides its services. From project mobilisation to go-live, this delivery role is at the forefront of Sapphire work to enhance and transform its client’s operations.

This is a consulting role and as such, whilst the hours resolve around a standard working day for the region, there are times when the job holder will need to work outside these times to assure the project’s progress and success.

Duties/Responsibilities: 

  • Provide guidance with process design.
  • Design, develop, and test automation workflows.
  • Providing implementation consultation and support services during the different phases of SAP Business One implementations, upgrades and other ad-hoc projects.
  • Proficiency with the US and UK SAP localisations; other localisations are an advantage.
  • Proficiency in using SQL-query, views and stored procedures. Proficiency in HANA syntaxis and reporting.
  • Proficiency in the data structures of SAP B1 and any add-ons
  • Customising forms and developing reports using Crystal Reports
  • Perform customizations via Transaction Notification; able to create formatted searches; and other complex system modifications via the Boyum B1 Usability Package; recognising and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions / add-ons and the business practices of the client.
  • Able to encourage the best practice for the client, even if this means the client changing their practices or processes.
  • Designing and conducting master data migration guidance or assistance from legacy systems into SAP Business One.
  • Helping to maintain or update Sapphire’s deployment methodology and share expertise with peers.
  • Prepare well-structured presentations, facilitate design, client training and client workshops or presentations, whether virtual or face to face.
  • Configure and optimise SAP Business One applications and solutions per the design documentation.
  • Able to follow and configure SAP B1 or add-on components from a system design document created by other peers or from a joint design.
  • Undertake unit testing and support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) paying attention to versioning and transition from development and test to production phases.
  • Maintain a project within the agreed scope and assist the project manager in identifying and quantifying change requests
  • Able to demonstrate a basic level of IT infrastructure awareness
  • Confident in presenting and explaining complex ERP or data concepts to the client
  • Demonstrate experience of working in a consulting capacity with clients, including management of time, quality and cost
  • Able to troubleshoot implementation issues and identify the root cause
  • Writing coherent, comprehensive and concise customer implementation and design documentation
  • Demonstrable client engagement expertise and confidence that results in the client asking for the individual by name for further work
  • Adds ideas, improvement and content to Sapphire’s SAP B1 deployment playbook.
  • Demonstrates a flexible work ethic and comfortable working remotely or on-site.
  • Teamwork skills


The ideal candidate will be:

  • Recent SAP Business One Accreditation (9.3 or higher) is highly desirable
  • Boyum B1 Usability package certification is desirable
  • Any other add-on product accreditations are desirable
  • 5 or more years of relevant application consultancy in SAP B1
  • Evidence of working in a consultative capacity with concurrent multiple clients

results.title: Operations Manager, Development
results.description:
Seeking a superstar systems enthusiast to lead on managing data systems, processes, and special initiatives for a team of equally superstar fundraisers. 

 

About the Position

Namati’s Development team has a strong track record of success, including a healthy number of long-time supporters, and significant recent wins enabling organizational growth and long-term sustainability. We are building a dynamic team of seasoned fundraisers to drive the continued revenue growth of Namati. The Operations Manager will be a central player on the team. This leader will manage information systems and processes to allow the teammates to work independently and effectively, while being efficient and coordinated across the organization. 

We seek a teammate who genuinely enjoys, and has demonstrable experience working on, the operations and administrative side of an organization or company. You feel satisfaction when you bring both precision and creative thinking to operational roles. You understand that “behind-the-scenes” work is critical to the achievement of any important mission. Fundraising experience is strongly preferred, but not required for the right candidate.

Our ideal candidate is an impeccably organized, creative, and confident team player. This person should possess exemplary process management and communication skills, outstanding attention to detail, drive to excel in all responsibilities, and capacity to grow in response to the needs of our growing team and organizational budget.

The Operations Manager will report to the Director of Development. Responsibilities include:

Operations

Manage all operational aspects of the Development team. For instance: 

  • Track proposals and reporting processes, collaborating with relevant team members to ensure impeccable, timely submissions.
  • Understand, manage, and improve our existing CRM system (Hubspot).
  • Oversee all shared projects in our project management software Asana, and help the team use the system optimally in  their own workflows. 
  • In partnership with the Director of Development, manage the fundraising forecasting system -- ensure that the forecasting chart is populated with accurate and up-to-date information, for use by both Development and Finance teams.
  • Maintain individual donor gifts processing and stewardship systems.
  • Oversee knowledge management, including filing and tracking all relevant internal and external materials in Google Drive.


Donor cultivation and stewardship: 

  • Manage email communications with funders via Hubspot
  • Research prospective donors and provide strategic recommendations on whether/how to approach the donors 
  • Keep abreast of funding trends to help Namati build and maintain a healthy funding pipeline.
  • Develop and execute creative initiatives to deepen ties with current and prospective donors 
  • Lead Namati’s year-end fundraising campaign  
  • Support and prepare the Director of Development and the Senior Manager of Development for funder meetings.

Here’s what you might have tackled in the past week:

  • Managed communications across several teams to ensure a timely submission for a foundation funder, paying careful attention to all reporting requirements.
  • Scheduled a kick-off call with teammates across multiple time zones for a large submission to a new government funder;  developed a detailed checklist for elements to include in the proposal,  ensured that each element has an owner, communicated any questions to the funder, and carefully read the fine print to confirm our eligibility.
  • Reviewed several online databases for new funding opportunities, flagging any promising opportunities for the Development Director.
  • Track recent donations in Hubspot and ensure that the donor receives a prompt response. 
  • Sent reminders to teammates about several reporting deadlines coming up in the next 30 days, and built a plan to make sure each team will have what they need to complete these reports.
  • Organized a virtual film screening for donors, followed by a dynamic and informative discussion between prospective donors and Namati program leads 

 

About You

  • Organized and an exceptional project manager: You know how to bring together geographically dispersed colleagues at varying levels of seniority (often with competing deadlines and priorities) to get things done. You can monitor all the details across multiple projects while ensuring the larger strategic plan is on track.
  • Exceptional communication skills: Your written and verbal communications evidence clarity of thought, sharpness of analysis, and you’re able to tailor your communications to meet people where they are.
  • Technologically-savvy: You’re a technophile; when working with a new program or application you quickly become fluent. You understand the stakes of securing our data and will do what it takes to protect and optimize it. You have (likely 2+ years) experience managing complex relational databases. Even better if you have experience with Hubspot.
  • Collaborative and service-oriented: You greet everyone you encounter with a collaborative spirit, kindness, and empathy. You like helping the team and serving our communities. 
  • Growth mindset: You’re always seeking to better yourself and your work, and you will push yourself to the peak of performance to help fulfill our mission. In service of that growth, you welcome and delight in feedback from supervisors, peers, reports, and anyone else

 

Location 

This position is remote (partially remote if based in/near Washington, DC) and open to any location in the United States. Please note that candidates must already be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered for the role.

Compensation & benefits
Throughout the hiring process we will seek to understand your specific skills, experience, and abilities as they will fit into our team and our job levels. The offer range for this position is likely to fall between $75,000 - $85,000 based on the final job level determined by the responsibility, scope, and complexity of the position. If you have salary requirements, please note them in your cover letter.

Namati offers an excellent benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance- Namati pays 80% of the base plan premium for individuals, and 50% for dependents
  • 3 weeks' paid vacation, 12 sick days, 12 federal holidays (plus the week between Christmas and New Years), 3 personal days, 6 weeks' parental leave
  • 401(k)- Namati contributes 5% of your salary plus matches your contribution up to an additional 5%
  • Pre-tax withholding for transportation and parking (Washington DC metro area)
  • Access to professional development opportunities


To Apply

Please complete our online application, including a resume and short application question. In the application, please submit a 200 word response to one of the application questions. No phone calls, please. Namati is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 

We'll accept applications until Friday, November 11, 2022. 

-----

Namati’s work has been featured in/on Democracy Journal, Amanpour & Co. New York Times, the Guardian, Devex, WIRED, the Washington Post, among others, and has been documented by the Sundance Institute. Vivek Maru, Namati’s CEO, gave a TED Talk in 2017 which has been viewed over 1.3 million times. In 2016, Namati was honored with the Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship and in 2017, the Schwab Foundation named Vivek Maru and colleague Sonkita Conteh two of its Social Entrepreneurs of the Year. Namati has a perfect score, 100/100, on Charity Navigator and has earned Guidestar’s Platinum Seal of Transparency.

results.title: Business Operations Manager
results.description:
About Apollo

Founded in 2015, Apollo is a leading sales intelligence and engagement platform trusted by over 20,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to the largest global enterprises. Our platform unifies a database of 250m contacts and 60 million business accounts with advanced intelligence and engagement tools, to help over 500,000 sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to connect with the right person at the right time with the right message, at speed and scale. We're also ranked #1 in Satisfaction on G2 Crowd for Sales Intelligence & Sales Engagement and are used by 1M professionals worldwide.

In the last year, we’ve grown ARR 3x, quadrupled our active users, maintained profitability, and closed a $110M Series C led by Sequoia Capital in March of 2022 to fuel the next phase of our growth. 

Working at Apollo

We are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence.  Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward.

Role & Team:

The mission of Apollo’s Business Operations team is to bring data insight, operational capability and strategic vision to drive growth and product strategy at Apollo. We partner with the executive team to define Apollo's business strategy, drive cross-functional projects and unlock new growth opportunities. Our team provides strategic perspectives and analytical horsepower to solve critical business strategy, optimization, and operations problems across the organization. 

We are a team of individuals with complementary skill sets. You will work collaboratively across Go-To-Market, Product, Finance and Marketing teams on a variety of strategic initiatives with a direct and quantifiable impact to our P&L. You will identify actionable insights, assess their impact, and lead execution & implementation. As one of the first members of the Business Operations team, you will be instrumental in shaping the future of the function and the overall business.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with key stakeholders across product, marketing, sales, and customer experience to drive product and business strategy by synthesizing insights and setting actionable plans.
  • Drive high-impact cross-functional initiatives such as pricing strategy, strategic investments and geographic expansion.
  • Leverage your business background to design and implement strong systems, processes and company rituals that will drive performance and collaboration throughout the organization.
  • Drive annual and quarterly business and OKR planning cycles with the leadership team to ensure Apollo is focusing and actioning on the most important near-term and long-term priorities.
  • Partner with the leadership team to define and iterate upon Apollo’s vision, mission and product strategy and conduct the requisite market, product and competitive analysis for these critical initiatives. 

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in highly strategic, operational, and analytical environments e.g. business operations, product management, investment banking, strategy consulting, private equity or venture capital.
  • Ability to solve complex business problems, think from first principles, and build scalable processes.
  • Strong analytical skills, including fluency with Microsoft Excel and BI tools like Looker, Tableau, and/or Amplitude. Knowledge of SQL is strongly preferred but not required. 
  • Experience in efficient and rigorous analysis, research and insight generation, and building hypotheses and an action plan. 
  • Proven track record of building strong collaborative relationships with teammates from a variety of backgrounds, geographies and disciplines.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

What You’ll Love About Apollo

Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
We’re on a mission to improve health through nutrition. 

At Simple, we are working on improving health through nutrition, because we believe that this is how we can have the biggest impact on the world. Evidence for the links between health behaviors and later disease and ill-health is strong. Effective interventions will enable people to live longer and healthier lives, and Simple is tasked with making this a reality.

Simple is a mobile application that helps people to improve their nutritional habits through various interventions. It combines personalized programs with meal tracking and health insights -- unlocking the path to healthier and happier lives. Launched in 2019, we rapidly grew to a 15M user base and a 100%+ YoY revenue growth. Now moving to a bigger market, we need to find an engineering leader who will help us to build the best product on the market in a rapid-growth company.

We are proud of our people. We believe that the Simple team is the key to our success and the company’s most valuable asset. So, if you are interested in health and wellness, enjoy solving challenging problems, and have always aspired to become part of a global project —  we want to hear from you!

As a Chief of Staff, you will be the CEO’s right-hand person and force multiplier in many instances. Have a significant impact on the efficiency and productivity of the company.

Reporting directly to the CEO. 

Build a healthier world with us!

 

What you’ll do:
  • Be an extension of the CEO;
  • Oversee and manage internal operations: prepare agendas, take notes, and assign action items at weekly meetings; manage the OKR and annual planning processes, support with board meeting prep, manage All Hands meetings;
  • Improves our management system and rolls out changes across the company;
  • Manage CEO’s time allocation closely to ensure it is spent on the top priorities for the company;
  • Partner with Product, Finance, Pricing, and Analytics to prepare analytical and financial reports and metric dashboards;
  • Manage high-priority cross-functional initiatives, ad-hoc support, or longer-term special projects (examples – culture, decision-making frameworks, organizational design);
  • Keep the CEO accountable for commitments while helping keep reports accountable for results;

What we look for:
  • Top management consulting experience or 5+ years of experience at a high-growth tech company preferred;
  • Familiar with current productivity tools (Jira, Asana, Slack, etc);
  • Highly organized, excellent communicator (both written and verbal);
  • Ability to work strategically and collaboratively across departments, as well as an influence at all levels of the organization;
  • Experience with data analysis, budget management, operations management;
  • Proven track record setting up and scaling different processes within a high-growth environment;
  • Strategic thinking, as well as a willingness to lead initiatives through implementation
  • Strong ownership mentality;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Fluency in English;

 

Why you might be excited about us:
  • You will help build a product that improves people’s health & lives through nutrition;
  • You will have a unique perspective across the company. This includes things like joining board meetings, executive staff meetings, and supporting the vision, and strategy setting for the company;
  • Being a chief of staff is a way to accelerate your career growth as you’re shadowing the founder & CEO directly;
  • Incredible insights into the different functions — product, marketing, growth, operations— of a fast-growing tech company and how they all work together;
  • Remote, with occasional business trips (roughly 10% of the time);
  • A competitive salary package based on your unique expertise, skillset, and impact on the business;
  • A stock option plan for every employee. When Simple does well, everyone benefits;
  • Top technical equipment, health insurance, relocation program, friendly and highly qualified colleagues, healthy snacks in our office’s kitchen (if you are in Cyprus, London).

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Our Mission

We uplift people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship.

To know more about 500 Latin America, click here.

Who We Are

500 Global is a venture capital firm with $2.7B in assets under management that invests in founders building fast-growing technology companies. We focus on markets where technology, innovation, and capital can unlock long-term value and drive economic growth. We work closely with key stakeholders and advise governments and corporations on how best to support entrepreneurial ecosystems so startups can thrive.

500 Global has backed over 5,000 founders representing more than 2,600 companies operating in 81 countries. We have invested in 51 companies valued at over $1 billion and 140+ companies valued at over $100 million (including private, public, and exited companies). Our 140+ plus team members are located in more than 20 countries and bring experience as entrepreneurs, investors, and operators from some of the world’s leading technology companies.

What We Need

The Chief of Staff for 500 Latin America (“CoS”) will be working with the Firm’s Managing Partner based in Latin America to facilitate the execution of strategic priorities, through relationship building, communications, project management, and problem-solving,

This person will serve as the right hand to the Managing Partner for their most important priorities, including the day-to-day operations of various regions, business units, and special projects, working closely with the Product and Portfolio Value teams to help them lead cross-functional projects.

The CoS will act as a strategist, consultant, and implementer, to ensure streamlined activities across Latin America and globally. They will contribute to the long-term success of the Firm by focusing on scaling operational infrastructure, as well as our expansion into new markets and products by seamlessly moving between strategic and tactical roadmaps.

We work at an incredible pace, so this person will need to be a self-starter with excellent EQ, written, verbal, and visual communication skills, strong time management skills, uncanny attention to detail, the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment, and above all, flexibility and discretion. This role may require non-standard working hours across multiple time zones and significant travel.

This position will be remote, although candidates already based in Mexico would be preferred for time zone coverage.

Who You Are

You share our passion for uplifting people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship. You thrive in entrepreneurial, creative, fast-paced environments managing multiple time zones and working with people around the world from different backgrounds and cultures. You have exceptional communication skills, organizational skills, keen attention to detail and a strong ability to manage relationships and projects, start-to-end. You gain energy from managing a wide variety of tasks and can change focus quickly as our industry and business needs change. You bring boundless positivity and energy to any workplace you work in.

What You Will Be Doing

Overall, the role is expected to be fluid and the candidate needs to be flexible, working alongside the shifting needs of the Firm. However, expected duties and responsibilities will include the following:

  • Act as an advisor to the Managing Partner assisting in facilitating effective decision-making and implementation, and working on projects and strategies.
  • Develop, manage and implement successful and consistent operational processes, systems, tools, playbooks, solutions and programs to make functions and projects more effective.
  • Coordinate and project manage the execution of assigned strategic initiatives, with specific responsibility for cross-functional delivery of key projects, ensuring smooth collaboration across multiple geographies and teams, tracking performance and successful completion of short and long-term goals reporting back to the Managing Partner on progress, blockers and risks.
  • Act as the communication arm for the Managing Partner with team members, clients, investors, community members and other stakeholders.
  • Organize and gather information from various departments and meetings on assigned strategic priorities and report that information, along with recommendations, to the Managing Partner.
  • Oversee the research and preparation of decks and briefing materials on strategic priorities or investor relations matters for upcoming meetings and events, draft event briefings and talking points, and support preparation for internal and external events on behalf of the Managing Partner.
  • Handling inquiries and routine or complex responsibilities as delegated.

Requirements

  • Experience in creative problem-solving and eliminating barriers at any organizational level.
  • Superior analytical and project management capabilities. Proven ability in prioritizing workflows, working independently within tight deadlines, and collaborating across teams with limited supervision.
  • Comfortable managing multiple projects across a wide variety of functional business problems.
  • Clear, effective communicator across written and verbal communication; able to influence and collaborate with stakeholders across functions at all levels of experience.
  • Creativity and comfortable with ‘blank sheet of paper’ assignments. Comfortable with ambiguity and identifying what may be needed to define clarity.
  • Discreet and trustworthy in handling sensitive commercial information and conducting discussions accordingly.

Technical Requirements

  • Strongly proficient in Excel / Sheets and Powerpoint / Slides.
  • Familiarity with CRM and database software.

Education & Experience

  • Strong academic track record, with a degree in Law, Business, Economics or Management.
  • 4-6 years of work experience as a Chief of Staff in an international organization, or work experience in either a top-tier strategy consulting firm or in-house strategy team, a high growth technology startup or venture capital firm, or a top-tier legal firm.

This role is accepting candidates based in Mexico. You must have the right to live and work in the country where you are located.

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Who We Are:

Drip (dripshop.live) is a fast-growing, VC-backed live shopping platform and community for collectibles, hobbyist products, and NFTs. Drip enables collectors to buy, sell, and stream with their engaged communities. We closed in $28.5M Series A and Seed funding at a $100M+ valuation to build our team and power delightful live commerce experiences from lead investors like Base10, Eniac and Kindred Ventures with participation from leading angels and tier-1 VC funds.

Our Values:

  • We are seller first
  • We are customer obsessed
  • Engaged with the community we build for
  • Embrace in radical ownership
  • Value radical candor
  • Strive to be excellent
  • Make the case for optimism

Job Overview:

As the Chief of Staff, you will work cross-functionally at Drip on highly impactful projects ranging from category expansion, and operational to finance to product. This is a highly impactful role that will work on the most pressing strategic initiatives at drip with high visibility.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional projects to scale functions and capabilities
  • Define and measure important KPIs
  • Drive efficiency and transparency in processes
  • Ensure roles and personnel are aligned with objectives
  • Spin-up new initiatives to drive growth

Required Background:

  • Ideally 4 to 6 years of overall work experience
  • Worked in top-tier consulting, banking and/or fast-growing marketplaces
  • Tech start-up experience preferably in eCommerce, marketplaces or content

Benefits:

  • Remote-first company with the opportunity to travel for team meetings and conferences
  • Competitive compensation
  • Competitive equity
  • Drip credits
  • Flexible PTO
  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • 401K, Flexible Spending Account
  • Short and Long term Disability, Basic Life & ADD

Extra Perks:

  • Talk Space Mental health therapy
  • Healthcare Advocate handle medical billing issues, legal advice and financial planning
  • One Medical telehealth primary care services, same day next day
  • Commuter benefits Pre-taxed commuter benefits
  • Teledoc24/7 access to U.S.-licensed doctors

Our Commitment to Inclusive Hiring:

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. In accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. We are happy to accommodate any disabilities or special needs

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Who We Are

PushBlack is the nation's largest media advocacy organization for Black Americans, currently serving 9 million people monthly across all platforms. We use the power of narrative, especially Black History, to educate and activate our subscribers to build their personal power and create lasting economic and political change.

In 2021, PushBlack grew to 5.9M subscribers on Facebook Messenger and 500K followers on Instagram. We also ran the nation’s largest GOTV campaign for Black Americans. In May 2020, we launched Black History Year, our critically acclaimed podcast, which has received over 3M downloads. In January 2022, we launched the pilot season of our finance podcast, Building Black Dollars. We’re at 17k downloads already. As we continue building our podcasting network, many more shows that we produce will serve our wide listenership.


What We’re Looking For

We‘re hiring an experienced, motivated, and entrepreneurial driven leader to be our Chief of Staff. The Chief of Staff will report directly to the Chief Executive Officer and will work closely with him to optimize his effectiveness, serving as a thought partner and trusted advisor and will lead the Executive Office team. This role will interface regularly with C-Suite leadership, but will not be a member of the C-Suite or hold operational responsibilities across the entire org. The ideal candidate is someone who is looking to provide strategic and program management support at the executive level. The Chief of Staff will support and manage the implementation of the Chief Executive Officer’s strategic priorities; manage and prioritize the workflow of the Chief Executive Officer's office; advance transparency, accessibility, inclusion, and a mission-centric focus through internal communications and collaboration.   • Manage engagement with the Board of Directors including, but not limited to, planning regular Board meetings and governance committee meetings; preparing and distributing Board meeting agendas, reports and supporting materials, and oversee communication with Board members to support the Board’s effectiveness;

Requirements

Skills + Experience

This Would Put You Over The Top

results.title: EDI Business Analyst – Healthcare
results.description:
Company Description

The U.S. healthcare sector is complex and dynamic - a vast and diverse network of entities that impacts the population and economy like no other. At USD$4.1 trillion, healthcare spending represents nearly 18% of U.S. GDP.  Despite clear changes in available resources, health service buying, selling, and settlements have seen little change in the past decade.

MacroHealth is a company you will be proud to be part of. As a future Macro-mate, you will help us achieve our mission to disrupt the U.S. health sector by building the most advanced and trusted market platform for health service payers and providers. 

At MacroHealth, we are creating intelligent Health Markets by building technology, knowledge, and relationships that enable payers and providers to optimize the buying and selling of health services. 

We offer our team members an inclusive and supportive environment where we help each other to grow as an individual and as a team. 



Job Description

MacroHealth is looking for an experienced and enthusiastic EDI Business Analyst to join our Implementations team. You will be part of a smart and collaborative Implementation team and stand as an essential component between MacroHealth, the Payers, and Provider networks, to drive exceptional customer experience during the implementation phase. 

You will also work closely with members of the Customer Success, Sales, and Development team and will receive support from a world-renowned leadership team with a track record of leading the development of multiple successful companies and products. If you have a customer-first mindset and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!

What You Will Do

  • Gather functional requirements including workflows, use cases, business rules and documents them in a structured manner  
  • Support design, build and test planning phases for medium to large scope enhancements and projects
  • Record and communicate issues and related details to internal and external stakeholders accurately and in a timely manner
  • Configure based on requirements and business rules for new/existing implementations  
  • Analyze, research, manage, and resolve functional (and other) inquiries received from customers during implementation project
  • Develop test plans, test cases, test scenarios and test reports on multiple projects
  • Facilitate testing meetings and communicate test progress status and results and other relevant information to project stakeholders and the management team 
  • Research pass and fail results and participate in defective meetings; providing information required to triage and resolve issues encountered during testing
  • Develop and incorporate organizational best practices into implementation processes    
  • Work independently and within a collaborative team environment with minimum supervision
  • Participate in creating new processes and templates as well as updating internal documentation and processes as needed
  • Perform root cause analysis, including corrective action planning and documentation to support analysis         



Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree in a related field
  • 3-5 years' experience working in a US Healthcare Payer environment and in a client facing client-facing capacity
  • Well versed with the layout of HIPAA X12 EDI data exchanges
  • Experience in writing and analyzing business and system requirement documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutions
  • In depth experience in Microsoft suites, including Word, Excel, Visio, Power Point, and SharePoint
  • Comfortable working on complex solutions, products and customer programs 
  • Self-starter with the ability to take ownership, work with tight timelines, and handle various tasks simultaneously
  • Excellent oral, written documentation, and presentation skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time within North America (when travel restrictions are lifted)

Bonus Point if You Have the Following:

  • Experience with SaaS software testing strategies, conditions, and evaluation of expected results
  • Hands on experience in JIRA or similar tools
  • Sound understanding of basic views of JSON, delimited and XML files and general database concepts



Additional Information

More about us

MacroHealth is a highly collaborative work environment where each team member can rely on the skills, expertise, and support of one another across the company. We operate with an open-door policy and are wide open to new perspectives for improving our operations and fueling future growth with a diverse and engaged team.  

We offer

  • Remote-friendly work environment 
  • Flexible PTO with no annual upper cap 
  • Extended parental leave  
  • Equity awards 
  • Extended medical, dental and vision plan for employee and dependents 
  • 401(k) contributions matching

How we protect team member health and safety 

At MacroHealth we recognize the impacts of the global pandemic have taken shape differently for each of us based on our role, our location, our family situations, and job transitions. Health, safety and wellbeing are top of mind for us in supporting safe office environments as well as engaging team members working from home. As part of this approach, a vaccination policy has been implemented requiring all eligible employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to work in one of our offices or travel to client locations. 

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion 

We are committed to facilitating constructive team member engagement and promoting a respectful work environment. We design our company processes to surface necessary conversations, engage multiple voices, remove barriers, and recognize contributions made at every level. We actively promote practices to create lasting change and partner with organizations that align with our values.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

This role requires legal authorization to work in US 

 

MacroHealth is an equal opportunity employer.

Ask our customers and they will tell you the main thing that differentiates Start with Data is our people. PIM is our purpose, and our strong set of values underpin how our employees & associates deliver such a great experience for all our customers.

 

We are looking for bright, talented, and driven people to come and join us on our journey.

 

You can read about some of our methodology and insights on our website.

 

About this role

Our Business Analysts work with our larger PIM and MDM implementation projects, with our retail, distributor and brand clients. These projects usually involve a large programme of digital and data transformation, across the product life cycle. Our business analysts are experts in process design and requirements capture, working closely with our client stakeholders and SMEs. Business Analysts often support the functional build of our PIM and MDM solutions during the build phase in a requirements and QA capacity. They also ensure quality, complete and consistent product data is at the foundation of each engagement.

 

Working under the leadership of a Lead Business Consultant, they support the definition, documentation and delivery of business requirements during our client PIM solution discovery, design and in conjunction with our Centre of Excellence, Data and Solution Architects to coordinate the delivery of the technology solution to meet the client's needs. Generally, these technology platforms will be one or many of the several software platforms we implement.

What we expect from you...

  • Run client-facing workshops to facilitate business process and data requirements definition.

  • Analyse large, as-is complex business processes and business architectures across the product lifecycle

  • Document target business processes & workflows

  • Consult and work with solution delivery teams to ensure solutions meet business requirements

  • Train client SMEs on new solution

 
You must have:

  • Worked either in consulting or on the clients side on one or more retail, brand, manufacturer or distributor data-related projects, ideally around the product data space - for example, eCommerce, Digital, ERP, supply chain, DAM, PLM or product & supplier management.

  • Been a business analyst on one or more complex end-to-end PIM or MDM projects

  • Deep understanding of retail and distribution operating models relating to product and master data management

  • Understanding of processes including new product introduction, vendor onboarding, merchandising, content enrichment, channel publishing and syndication

  • Understand how to create a business requirements document and functional specification for a PIM or MDM solution

  • Experience supporting functional testing and UAT in a hands-on capacity

  • Experience writing training materials and training business users

  • Used Jira, Confluence, Visio, Lucid Charts

  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with diligent attention to detail

  • Proven experience in UML and other process modelling techniques

  • Understand how to estimate Business Analysis effort

 
You also may have...

  • You have played a role on the client-side in product data management, or an associated role in digital product ownership on a transactional website or app

  • You understand the key concepts of data governance and data quality such as accuracy, consistency, completeness

  • Having a view of the wider business processes and systems to build a picture of how new/improved integrations will be received

  • Have used 1 or more PIM or MDM solutions such as Enterworks, Stibo, Riversand, Informatica, Salsify, Sales Layer

 

Our Culture & way of doing things

We have a vibrant, exciting and dynamic work environment on our projects. Our teams are multi-disciplined and relatively self-organising, so you will be used to operating in a flat, collaborative environment. We are highly entrepreneurial and value self-starters and solutions-oriented people.

Pay & Benefits
  • We look for exceptional Permanent and Fixed Term Contract Consultants and our salaries, culture, and benefits reflect that:
  • Competitive salary - between £45,000 - £80,000 depending on experience
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Pension at a 5% matched contribution
  • Private medical coverCareer progression and training opportunities
  • Mac laptop and Apple phone when you start
  • Being part of the Start with Data community - In-person "Summer Party" and "Winter Party", online social events, daily trivia, online wellness events, and virtual coffee 
 
We also offer a chance to join our Talent Network, where you can work as a Contract Consultant (our contracts are OIR35 and there will be an aligned statement of works to your Ltd Company)

 

At this time we are not engaging with recruitment companies. If we ever need to explore other avenues, we have preferred suppliers on standby.

results.title: Executive Assistant to Support High-Functioning CEO
results.description:
Paradigm Life believes in a better financial system. One that makes life more predictable. We help clients create customized financial solutions proven to reduce risk, increase growth, minimize taxes, and put clients in the driver’s seat of their wealth - not Wall Street.

We are looking for an Executive Assistant who knows how to compliment a CEO who hasn’t worked with an assistant in two years. Our CEO knows of the benefits of having a great Executive Assistant, yet he’s never experienced what it’s like to work with an Executive Assistant who anticipates his needs, makes his life easier, and knows how to oversee functions to keep a pulse on the operations so he doesn’t have to.

The Executive Assistant will report to the President of the Company and will support both the CEO and President; with a majority of the time spent with the CEO. When the CEO is kept out of operations, yet still has a pulse on each team and scoreboard and can spend his time being creative within the company, you will know you are successful. You should have a go-getter attitude, experience in an Executive Assistant position, and possess a versatile skillset to ensure the company’s workflow runs smoothly. It’s imperative this candidate be proactive, open to new challenges, meet deadlines, communicate effectively, and serve as a great team player.

Requirements

Persona Defined:

  1. Analyzer: Enjoys finding patterns, identifying problems & creating efficiencies.
  2. Optimizer: Naturally systemizes the predictable and fine tunes optimization.
  3. Influencer: Ability to collaborate and get buy-in that inspires and helps guide stakeholders to drive the business.

 

You will function as the liaison on behalf of the CEO between multiple teams, often driving key initiatives.

Key Job Functions Include, But Are Not Limited To:

  • Meeting Coordination and Support
    • Includes meeting preparation, agenda creation, notes, follow up on tasks and commitments made
  • Ensure Workflows are Running Smoothly and Optimizing Where Needed
  • Client Management
    • Screen and direct phone calls
    • Distribute and reply to correspondence
    • Coordinate client requests
  • Office Resources and Supplies Management
  • Visitor Reception, Management and Hospitality
  • Format, Prepare and Maintain Information for Internal and External Communication – Memos, Emails, Presentations, Reports, Dashboards, etc.
  • Organize Performance Reports
  • Outlook Management for the CEO (Email & Calendar)
  • Event Management
  • Basic Project Management
  • Metrics and Numbers Organization and Preparation:
    • Tableau
    • Smartsheet
    • HubSpot
    • Salesforce
    • Project Status
    • Expense
  • Travel and Accommodation Arrangements (for CEO, President, and Others)
  • Assist inManaging Strategic Plan, Project, and Initiative Alignment with Company Goals and Vision
  • Provide General Administrative Support

Software Platforms Used (Experience Welcomed, But Not Required)

  • Workplace
  • Microsoft Office
  • HubSpot
  • Salesforce
  • Jira
  • Tableau
  • BambooHR

Communication

  • Communication with the CEO will be done using voice/audio memos as his preferred method.
  • Daily 15-minute company-wide standup @ 11am MT. (Zoom and streamed to Workplace).
  • Workplace is used for company-wide announcements and communications.
  • Slack is used within each team.

 

Additional Requirements:

  • Experience as an Executive Assistant (6 years minimum, 12+ years preferred)
  • Comfortable using multiple technologies (tech savvy)
  • Effective remote work experience (3 years minimum)
  • Must be willing to take the Kolbe or Predictive Index Assessment

 

Within this high-functioning system the Company’s rhythm is to operate in three 4-month cycles yearly.

  1. Initiatives
  2. Targets
  3. Projects

 

The team has grown to approximately 70 (including contractors) and each team works independently while not being siloed. Performance measurements are constant and are measured daily using a scoreboard. If you love numbers, tracking KPIs, and hitting goals this is a great role for you.

Benefits

It has taken two years, but the Company culture is in a word - AWESOME! For instance, it’s remote and the hours are based on your location, not the company’s (although there should naturally be some overlap). Everyone on the team is committed to having fun, being client centric, excited about their work, genuinely optimistic, and seeks opportunity.

Our mission first began in 2007 but was fortified during the 2008-2009 Great Recession when we discovered first-hand the value of our principles and strategies. The failure of traditional financial planning methodology was exposed in more ways than one. This discovery was the result of meeting and subsequently helping thousands of individuals and businesses learn about sound wealth strategies and how to ensure that such an occurrence didn't happen again. The Company is a fully developed virtual business which allows our team the opportunity to connect with clients in all 50 states, Canada and US Territories.

If you have a calling to make a difference in people’s lives, this is an exciting opportunity for you. Join and contribute to an innovative team and help us carry out the mission of the Company - to come alongside clients and implement a personalized wealth strategy that empowers them to live a fulfilling life now and ensure the future of their dreams.

 

Salary: $48,000 - $75,000, Depending on Experience.

Bonus: 7-10% of salary

Vacation: 4-6 weeks a year

Medical/Dental/Vision: 40-70% company paid
